page.title: 17HOUSING IN LLANBISTER
page.content: There are 50-55 dwellings in the area, most are owner-occupied.Three are holiday cottages and about a third are farms or have a small quantity of land attached. About half the dwellings are in the village one house is 230 years old, a few others at least 150 years of age, and many houses in the area were built more than 100 years ago.Most have been modernised, and have electricity and telephones. Houses in the village have mains water other homes a private supply. There are 4 bungalows and 4 houses on a council estate these are prefabricated concrete.One bungalow has been built on a private estate but is unoccupied.There is planning permission for another 5. Two of the cottages in the village are empty, and the vicarage is unoccupied.
